bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:218278]
[%Nr. 2910]
[!Übersetze die Phrasal verbs ins Englische]

0. auf ein Baby aufpassen → to [_look after][@example] a baby
1. in den Bus einsteigen → to [_get on] the bus
2. ein Buch suchen → to [_look for] a book
3. das Licht anschalten → to [_switch on] the light
4. den Plan aufgeben → to [_give up] the plan
5. die Jeans anprobieren → to [_try on] the jeans
6. die Jacke ausziehen → to [_take off] the coat
7. den Bleistift wegwerfen → to [_throw away] the pencil
8. das Radio leiser stellen → to [_turn down] the radio
9. das Feuer löschen → to [_put out] the fire
10. an Geister glauben → to [_believe in] ghosts

bit.body:
0. auf ein Baby aufpassen → to {0} a baby
1. in den Bus einsteigen → to {1} the bus
2. ein Buch suchen → to {2} a book
3. das Licht anschalten → to {3} the light
4. den Plan aufgeben → to {4} the plan
5. die Jeans anprobieren → to {5} the jeans
6. die Jacke ausziehen → to {6} the coat
7. den Bleistift wegwerfen → to {7} the pencil
8. das Radio leiser stellen → to {8} the radio
9. das Feuer löschen → to {9} the fire
10. an Geister glauben → to {10} ghosts
bit.instruction: Übersetze die Phrasal verbs ins Englische

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:218279]
[%Nr. 2912]
[!Setze die folgenden Verben **(believe, fill, get, look, put, switch, take, throw, turn, try)** und die passenden Präpositionen **(away, down, for, in, off, on, out)** ein.]

0. My parents are out. So I have to [_look after][@example] my baby-brother.
1. Quick! [_Get on] the bus. It's ready to leave.
2. I don't know where my book is. I have to [_look for] it.
3. It's dark inside. Can you [_swich on] the light, please?
4. [_Fill in] the form, please.
5. I need some new clothes. Why don't you [_try on] these jeans?
6. It's warm inside. [_Take off] your coat.
7. This pencil is really old. You can [_throw] it [_away].
8. It's so loud here. Can you [_turn down] the radio a little?
9. The firemen were able to [_put out] the fire in Church Street.
10. Does your little brother [_believe in] ghosts?

bit.body:
0. My parents are out. So I have to {0} my baby-brother.
1. Quick! {1} the bus. It's ready to leave.
2. I don't know where my book is. I have to {2} it.
3. It's dark inside. Can you {3} the light, please?
4. {4} the form, please.
5. I need some new clothes. Why don't you {5} these jeans?
6. It's warm inside. {6} your coat.
7. This pencil is really old. You can {7} it {8}.
8. It's so loud here. Can you {9} the radio a little?
9. The firemen were able to {10} the fire in Church Street.
10. Does your little brother {11} ghosts?
bit.instruction: Setze die folgenden Verben **(believe, fill, get, look, put, switch, take, throw, turn, try)** und die passenden Präpositionen **(away, down, for, in, off, on, out)** ein.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:218280]
[%Nr. 2916]
[!Wähle aus den Vorgaben die richtige Präposition aus und bilde sinnvolle Sätze.]

1. He comes [-across][-back][-down][+from][-in][-off][-on][-out][-over][-up] Italy.
2. The blue bar came [-across][-back][-down][-from][+in][-off][-on][-out][-over][-up] last.
3. Come [-across][-back][-down][-from][-in][-off][+on][-out][-over][-up] try once more.
4. We came [-across][+back][-down][-from][-in][-off][-on][-out][-over][-up] home very late.
5. She came [+across][-back][-down][-from][-in][-off][-on][-out][-over][-up] some old letters in the cellar.
6. The price of computers is coming [-across][-back][+down][-from][-in][-off][-on][-out][-over][-up].
7. He is trying to come [-across][-back][-down][-from][-in][+off][-on][-out][-over][-up] these tablets. 
8. The sun came [-across][-back][-down][-from][-in][-off][-on][+out][-over][-up] after the rain had stopped.
9. They came [-across][-back][-down][-from][-in][-off][-on][-out][+over][-up] to New Orleans last summer.
10. His birthday is coming [-across][-back][-down][-from][-in][-off][-on][-out][-over][+up] next week.

bit.body:
1. He comes {0} Italy.
2. The blue bar came {1} last.
3. Come {2} try once more.
4. We came {3} home very late.
5. She came {4} some old letters in the cellar.
6. The price of computers is coming {5}.
7. He is trying to come {6} these tablets. 
8. The sun came {7} after the rain had stopped.
9. They came {8} to New Orleans last summer.
10. His birthday is coming {9} next week.
bit.instruction: Wähle aus den Vorgaben die richtige Präposition aus und bilde sinnvolle Sätze.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:218281]
[%Nr. 2918]
[!Wähle aus den Vorgaben die richtige Präposition aus und bilde sinnvolle Sätze.]

1. When we got [-along][-away][+back][-down][-in][-off][-out][-through][-together][-up] to the room, she had already left.
2. The police let him get [-along][+away][-back][-down][-in][-off][-out][-through][-together][-up] with only a $10 ticket.
3. Look! Our plane is getting [-along][-away][-back][-down][+in][-off][-out][-through][-together][-up] now.
4. Students have to get [-along][-away][-back][-down][-in][-off][-out][-through][-together][+up] when the teacher comes in.
5. We have to get [-along][-away][-back][-down][-in][-off][-out][-through][+together][-up] for our presentation on Friday.
6. Please return the book when you got [-along][-away][-back][-down][-in][-off][-out][+through][-together][-up] it.
7. My father stopped the car and got [-along][-away][-back][-down][-in][-off][+out][-through][-together][-up].
8. Does Ken get [+along][-away][-back][-down][-in][-off][-out][-through][-together][-up] with his parents?
9. We couldn't get [-along][-away][-back][+down][-in][-off][-out][-through][-together][-up] what the teacher said. 
10. They got [-along][-away][-back][-down][-in][+off][-out][-through][-together][-up] the bus and walked to school.

bit.body:
1. When we got {0} to the room, she had already left.
2. The police let him get {1} with only a $10 ticket.
3. Look! Our plane is getting {2} now.
4. Students have to get {3} when the teacher comes in.
5. We have to get {4} for our presentation on Friday.
6. Please return the book when you got {5} it.
7. My father stopped the car and got {6}.
8. Does Ken get {7} with his parents?
9. We couldn't get {8} what the teacher said. 
10. They got {9} the bus and walked to school.
bit.instruction: Wähle aus den Vorgaben die richtige Präposition aus und bilde sinnvolle Sätze.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:218282]
[%Nr. 2914]
[!Wähle aus den Vorgaben die richtige Präposition aus und bilde sinnvolle Sätze.]

1. Henry looked [-after][-at][-back on][-down on][-forward to][-in][-out][-round][+through][-up] the magazine quickly.
2. Look [-after][-at][-back on][-down on][-forward to][-in][+out][-round][-through][-up]! There's a bus coming! It is going to hit you!
3. Did the doctor look [-after][+at][-back on][-down on][-forward to][-in][-out][-round][-through][-up] your leg?
4. She looked [-after][-at][-back on][-down on][-forward to][-in][-out][-round][-through][+up] from her book when she heard the noise.
5. We were looking [-after][-at][-back on][-down on][-forward to][-in][-out][+round][-through][-up] the shops when we were in Ashville.
6. They are looking [-after][-at][-back on][-down on][+forward to][-in][-out][-round][-through][-up] meeting their friends.
7. How do you feel when you look [-after][-at][+back on][-down on][-forward to][-in][-out][-round][-through][-up] your childhood?
8. John has to look [+after][-at][-back on][-down on][-forward to][-in][-out][-round][-through][-up] his younger brother.
9. Our boss looks [-after][-at][-back on][+down on][-forward to][-in][-out][-round][-through][-up] some people in his firm.
10. I look [-after][-at][-back on][-down on][-forward to][+in][-out][-round][-through][-up] on my child every now and then.

bit.body:
1. Henry looked {0} the magazine quickly.
2. Look {1}! There's a bus coming! It is going to hit you!
3. Did the doctor look {2} your leg?
4. She looked {3} from her book when she heard the noise.
5. We were looking {4} the shops when we were in Ashville.
6. They are looking {5} meeting their friends.
7. How do you feel when you look {6} your childhood?
8. John has to look {7} his younger brother.
9. Our boss looks {8} some people in his firm.
10. I look {9} on my child every now and then.
bit.instruction: Wähle aus den Vorgaben die richtige Präposition aus und bilde sinnvolle Sätze.

bitmark:
[.multiple-response:bitmark--]
[@id:218283]
[%Nr. 2920]
[!Entscheide, ob die Phrasal verbs trennbar sind oder nicht. Wähle die korrekten Sätze aus.]

===
[!1.turn on →]
[+He turned on the light.]
[+He turned the light on.]
===
[!2. hand in →]
[+Hand in your homework on time.]
[+Hand your homework in on time.]
===
[!3. get on →]
[+They got on the bus.]
[-They got the bus on.]
===
[!4. look up →]
[+Look up the words in a dictionary.]
[+Look the words up in a dictionary.]
===
[!5. grow up →]
[+He grew up in North Carolina.]
[-He grew in North Carolina up.]
===
[!6. check in →]
[+We checked in at our hotel.]
[-We checked at our hotel in.]
===
[!7. give up →]
[+They gave up smoking.]
[+They gave smoking up.]
===
[!8. ask out →]
[+Henry asked Jenny out.]
[+Henry asked Jenny out.]
===
[!9. mix up →]
[+We mixed up the numbers.]
[+We mixed the numbers up.]
===
[!10. look after →]
[+Dennis looked after his brother.]
[-Dennis looked his brother after.]
===

bit.instruction: Entscheide, ob die Phrasal verbs trennbar sind oder nicht. Wähle die korrekten Sätze aus.

responses.response: Hand in your homework on time.
Hand your homework in on time.
Look up the words in a dictionary.
Look the words up in a dictionary.
He grew up in North Carolina.
He grew in North Carolina up.
We checked in at our hotel.
We checked at our hotel in.
